meanings.definition: Extremely large or vast in size or scale.
meanings.sent1: The elephant was an astronomic creature compared to the tiny mouse.
meanings.sent2: The skyscraper's height was truly astronomic, reaching far into the sky.
meanings.sent3: The amount of ice cream he ate was astronomic, making his friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was astronomic, filling her heart to the brim.
meanings.sent5: The mountain's shadow cast an astronomic silhouette over the valley.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to astronomy or the study of celestial objects.
meanings.sent1: The astronomic discoveries made by scientists expanded our knowledge of the universe.
meanings.sent2: Stargazing is an astronomic hobby that allows us to appreciate the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The astronaut's dog had an astronomic interest in the stars, always looking up.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were as vast and astronomic as the galaxies she studied.
meanings.sent5: The telescope revealed an astronomic number of stars twinkling in the night.

meanings.definition: Incredibly high or impressive in quantity or amount.
meanings.sent1: The restaurant served an astronomic portion of fries, more than anyone could finish.
meanings.sent2: The singer's talent was astronomic, captivating the audience with every note.
meanings.sent3: The cat's curiosity reached astronomic levels as it explored every corner of the room.
meanings.sent4: The company's success was astronomic, surpassing all expectations in the market.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks display was astronomic, lighting up the night sky with a burst of colors.
